BBQ & Grilling.description: Perfect for grilled meats and BBQ

Meat Dishes.description: Ideal for beef, pork, chicken, lamb

Seafood.description: Great with fish, shrimp, and seafood

Pasta & Noodles.description: Perfect for pasta and noodle dishes

Dipping & Dressing.description: Great as dips and salad dressings

sauces.name: Soy Sauce
sauces.description: Traditional Japanese soy sauce for umami flavor

sauces.name: Teriyaki Sauce
sauces.description: Sweet Japanese glaze with soy sauce and ginger

instructions: Combine soy sauce, mirin, and brown sugar in a small saucepan over medium heat.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger. Stir well.
Bring to a simmer and cook for 3-4 minutes.
Mix cornstarch with water to create a slurry.
Add slurry to the sauce and stir continuously until thickened (about 1-2 minutes).
Remove from heat and let cool. Store in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

sauces.name: Sriracha
sauces.description: Thai hot sauce made from chili peppers and garlic

ingredients: 1 lb red jalape√±o or Fresno peppers, stems removed
instructions: Roughly chop peppers and garlic, then blend in food processor until smooth.
Transfer to a bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let ferment at room temperature for 3-5 days, stirring daily.
After fermentation, transfer mixture to a saucepan.
Add sugar, salt, vinegar, and fish sauce. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Let cool, then blend again until very smooth.
Strain through fine mesh if you want smooth texture (optional).
Store in sterilized bottles. Keeps for several months in refrigerator.

sauces.name: Hoisin Sauce
sauces.description: Sweet and savory Chinese sauce with fermented beans

sauces.name: Oyster Sauce
sauces.description: Rich and savory sauce made from oyster extracts

sauces.name: Gochujang
sauces.description: Korean fermented chili paste with sweet and spicy notes

sauces.name: Chili Oil
sauces.description: Spicy oil infused with chili peppers and aromatics

instructions: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium-low heat to 250¬∞F (120¬∞C).
Add garlic, ginger, star anise, and cinnamon stick. Fry gently for 5 minutes.
Remove aromatics and strain oil if desired.
Place chili flakes, Sichuan peppercorns, salt, and sugar in a heat-proof bowl.
Heat oil to 375¬∞F (190¬∞C) and carefully pour over the chili mixture.
Stir well and let cool completely.
Store in an airtight jar. Best after 24 hours. Lasts for months!

sauces.name: Sweet Chili Sauce
sauces.description: Sweet and tangy sauce with chili peppers

instructions: Combine vinegar, sugar, water, garlic, chilies, and salt in a saucepan.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring until sugar dissolves.
Reduce heat and simmer for 5 minutes.
Mix cornstarch with 3 tbsp water to create a slurry.
Add slurry to the sauce and stir until thickened (about 2 minutes).
Remove from heat and let cool completely.
Store in airtight jar in refrigerator for up to 1 month.

sauces.name: BBQ Sauce
sauces.description: Sweet and smoky barbecue sauce with molasses

instructions: Combine all ingredients in a medium saucepan.
Whisk together until well combined.
Bring to a boil over medium heat.
Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
The sauce should thicken and flavors will meld together.
Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.
Let cool before using. Store in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

sauces.name: Ranch Dressing
sauces.description: Classic American ranch with herbs and buttermilk

ingredients: 2 tbsp fresh dill, chopped (or 2 tsp dried)
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, sour cream, and buttermilk until smooth.
Add minced garlic, dill, chives, parsley, and onion powder.
Season with salt, pepper, and lemon juice.
Whisk until well combined.
Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving to let flavors develop.
Store in refrigerator for up to 1 week. Thin with more buttermilk if needed.

sauces.name: Buffalo Sauce
sauces.description: Tangy and spicy sauce perfect for wings

instructions: Melt butter in a small saucepan over low heat.
Add hot sauce, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, and spices.
Whisk continuously until well combined and heated through.
Do not let it boil - keep heat low to prevent separation.
Simmer for 2-3 minutes, whisking occasionally.
Remove from heat and use immediately, or let cool and store.
Store in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. Reheat gently before using.

sauces.name: Honey Mustard
sauces.description: Sweet and tangy mustard with honey

instructions: In a bowl, whisk together Dijon mustard, honey, and mayonnaise until smooth.
Add yellow mustard and lemon juice, whisk well.
Season with garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Taste and adjust sweetness by adding more honey if desired.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 15 minutes before serving.
Store in airtight container in refrigerator for up to 3 weeks.

sauces.name: Pesto
sauces.description: Fresh basil, pine nuts, parmesan, and olive oil

instructions: Toast pine nuts in a dry pan over medium heat for 2-3 minutes until fragrant. Let cool.
In a food processor, pulse basil, pine nuts, and garlic until coarsely chopped.
Add Parmesan cheese and pulse to combine.
With processor running, slowly drizzle in olive oil until smooth.
Add salt, pepper, and lemon juice. Pulse to combine.
Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.
Store in airtight container with thin layer of olive oil on top. Keeps 1 week in fridge or freeze for 3 months.

sauces.name: Garlic Aioli
sauces.description: Creamy garlic mayonnaise with lemon zest

instructions: In a bowl, whisk together egg yolks, minced garlic, lemon juice, and mustard.
Very slowly drizzle in olive oil while whisking constantly. Start with just drops.
As mixture begins to emulsify and thicken, you can add oil in a thin stream.
Continue whisking until all oil is incorporated and aioli is thick and creamy.
Season with salt, pepper, and lemon zest if using.
If too thick, thin with a teaspoon of water or lemon juice.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving. Use within 3 days.

sauces.name: Tartar Sauce
sauces.description: Creamy sauce with pickles and capers

ingredients: 1 tbsp fresh dill, chopped (or 1 tsp dried)
instructions: In a bowl, combine mayonnaise, pickles, and capers.
Add lemon juice, dill, parsley, and mustard.
Season with onion powder, pepper, and salt.
Mix well until all ingredients are evenly distributed.
Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving to let flavors meld.
Store in refrigerator for up to 1 week.

sauces.name: Hollandaise
sauces.description: Rich and buttery French sauce with lemon

ingredients: 1/2 cup (1 stick) unsalted butter, melted and hot
instructions: Fill a saucepan with 1-2 inches of water and bring to a simmer.
In a heatproof bowl that fits over the pan (not touching water), whisk egg yolks and lemon juice.
Place bowl over simmering water and whisk constantly for 2-3 minutes until slightly thickened.
Very slowly drizzle in hot melted butter while whisking constantly.
Continue whisking until sauce thickens and becomes creamy (5-7 minutes).
If sauce gets too thick, whisk in warm water 1 tsp at a time.
Season with salt and cayenne pepper.
Serve immediately. Cannot be stored - best made fresh.

sauces.name: Salsa Verde
sauces.description: Tangy green sauce with tomatillos and jalape√±os

ingredients: 1 lb tomatillos, husks removed and rinsed
instructions: Preheat broiler. Place tomatillos and jalape√±os on a baking sheet.
Broil for 5-7 minutes until charred and blistered, turning once.
Let cool slightly, then remove stems from jalape√±os.
Add tomatillos, jalape√±os, onion, and garlic to a blender or food processor.
Add cilantro, lime juice, salt, and cumin if using.
Pulse until you reach desired consistency (chunky or smooth).
Taste and adjust seasonings. Add more salt or lime juice as needed.
Store in refrigerator for up to 1 week or freeze for 3 months.

sauces.name: Pico de Gallo
sauces.description: Fresh tomato salsa with onions and cilantro

ingredients: 1-2 jalape√±o peppers, seeded and finely chopped
instructions: Dice tomatoes and place in a bowl. Drain excess liquid if needed.
Add finely chopped onion, jalape√±os, and cilantro.
Pour lime juice over the mixture.
Season with salt and pepper.
Gently toss all ingredients together until well combined.
Let sit for 10-15 minutes to let flavors meld.
Taste and adjust seasonings. Add more lime or salt if needed.
Best served fresh. Can be refrigerated for 2-3 days but may become watery.

sauces.name: Chipotle Sauce
sauces.description: Smoky and spicy sauce with chipotle peppers

ingredients: 1 can (7 oz) chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
instructions: Add chipotle peppers with some adobo sauce to a blender or food processor.
Add mayonnaise, sour cream, and minced garlic.
Add lime juice, honey, cumin, and salt.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Taste and adjust heat by adding more chipotles or balance with more sour cream.
Adjust seasonings as needed.
Transfer to airtight container and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Store in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

sauces.name: Mole Sauce
sauces.description: Rich Mexican sauce with chocolate and spices

ingredients: 3 dried ancho chilies, stemmed and seeded
2 dried pasilla chilies, stemmed and seeded
instructions: Toast dried chilies in a dry pan for 1-2 minutes. Cover with hot water and soak for 20 minutes.
Heat oil in a large pan. Saut√© onion and garlic until softened.
In the same pan, toast almonds and sesame seeds until fragrant.
Drain chilies and add to a blender with onion mixture, nuts, spices, and 1 cup broth.
Blend until very smooth, adding more broth as needed.
Pour sauce back into pan. Add remaining broth, chocolate, tomato paste, and sugar.
Simmer on low heat for 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally until thickened.
Season with salt. Store in refrigerator for 1 week or freeze for 3 months.

sauces.name: Tahini
sauces.description: Creamy sesame paste sauce with lemon

ingredients: 1/4 cup cold water (plus more as needed)
instructions: In a bowl, whisk tahini paste until smooth.
Add lemon juice and whisk - mixture will seize up and thicken (this is normal).
Add minced garlic, cumin, and salt. Whisk to combine.
Gradually add cold water, 1 tablespoon at a time, whisking constantly.
Continue adding water until sauce reaches desired consistency (smooth and pourable).
Taste and adjust seasonings. Add more lemon, salt, or garlic as needed.
Stir in fresh parsley and cayenne if using.
Store in refrigerator for up to 1 week. Thin with water if it thickens.

sauces.name: Harissa
sauces.description: North African hot chili pepper paste

ingredients: 6-8 dried red chilies (guajillo or New Mexico)
instructions: Remove stems and most seeds from dried chilies. Soak in hot water for 20 minutes.
Toast caraway, coriander, and cumin seeds in a dry pan until fragrant. Grind in spice grinder.
Drain chilies and add to food processor with garlic and ground spices.
Add paprika, olive oil, lemon juice, tomato paste, and salt.
Process until smooth, scraping down sides as needed.
Add 1-2 tablespoons of water if mixture is too thick.
Taste and adjust seasonings. Add more salt or lemon as needed.
Store in jar covered with thin layer of olive oil. Keeps 2 weeks in fridge or freeze for 3 months.

sauces.name: Za'atar Oil
sauces.description: Herbal oil with thyme, sumac, and sesame

instructions: If making za'atar blend: combine dried thyme, sesame seeds, sumac, and salt.
In a small bowl, combine olive oil and za'atar blend.
Add sesame seeds, sumac, and salt. Mix well.
Add minced garlic and lemon zest if using.
Let mixture sit for at least 30 minutes to let flavors infuse.
Stir well before using. Oil will separate - this is normal.
Store in airtight jar at room temperature for up to 2 weeks or refrigerate for 1 month.
Bring to room temperature before serving if refrigerated.
